summary: An Ordinance providing for the improvement of Twenty-first Avenue Northwest, from West Sixty-fifth Street to West Seventy-fifth Street; West Seventieth Street, from Twenty-first Avenue Northwest to Twenty-fourth Avenue Northwest; Sloop Place, from Nineteenth Avenue Northwest to Twenty-first Avenue Northwest; Canoe Place, from Nineteenth Avenue Northwest to Twenty-first Avenue Northwest, and Twentieth Avenue Northwest, from Canoe Place to West Seventy-fifth Street, all in the City of Seattle, by grading and curbing the same, in accordance with Resolution No. 1258 of the City Council of the City of Seattle, and providing for the payment therefor by the mode of "Payment by Bonds," as provided by the laws of the State of Washington and the Charter and Ordinances of the City of Seattle
